import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { Slider, Grid, Select, InputLabel, Typography, FormControl, MenuItem, Button, Paper } from '@material-ui/core'; /* var test = { 'name': { 'vodka': 5, 'orange': 10 } } */ class ConfigureScreen extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { 'name': '', 'ingredients': 1, 'ingredient1': '', 'quantity1': 0, 'ingredient2': '', 'quantity2': 0, 'ingredient3': '', 'quantity3': 0, 'ingredient4': '', 'quantity4': 0, 'ingredient5': '', 'quantity5': 0, 'ingredient6': '', 'quantity6': 0, } } handleChange(event, index) { this.setState({ [ingredients[index][event.target.name]]: event.target.value }) } makeIngredient(index) { return Ingredient {index + 1}
Ingredient

Quantity
} render() { const handleChange = this.handleChange.bind(this); console.log(this.state) return Ingredient 1
{/* Ingredient */} Ingredient

Quantity
} } export default ConfigureScreen
